edu.westga.turtle.model
Class Turtle

java.lang.Object
  acm.graphics.GObject
      acm.graphics.GCompound
          edu.westga.turtle.model.Turtle
All Implemented Interfaces:
acm.graphics.GContainer, acm.graphics.GScalable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class Turtle
extends acm.graphics.GCompound

Turtle represents a graphical turtle that can move around on the screen, turn, and raise or lower its tail. When its tail is lowered, it "scratches" a line on the screen that shows the path it takes.

Version:
Spring, 2012
Author:
CS 1301

public static final double TURTLE_SPEED
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Turtle

public Turtle(int size,
              double x,
              double y)
Creates a new Turtle object at the specified x,y location with the specified size.

Precondition:
size > 0 AND
x >= 0 AND x <= ApplicationDriver.WINDOW_SIZE AND
y >= 0 AND y <= ApplicationDriver.WINDOW_SIZE

Postcondition: The Turtle instance is at x,y AND is size pixels long.

Parameters:
size - Size of the turtle in pixels
x - The initial x coordinate of the turtle
y - The initial y coordinate of the turtle
Method Detail

moveForward

public void moveForward()
Moves the turtle forward in its current direction by a distance equal to its own size. The turtle draws a line if its tail is down, but otherwise just moves.

Precondition: none

Postcondition: The turtle is 1 body length from its starting point in the direction it's moving.
If its tail is down (i.e., tailDown() returns true), there is a line on the screen in its trail.

turnLeft

public void turnLeft()
Turns the turtle 90 degrees to its left.

Precondition: none

Postcondition: The turtle is facing 90 degrees left of its previous direction.

lowerTail

public void lowerTail()
Drops the turtle's tail to the ground so it will draw a line when it moves.

Precondition: none

Postcondition: The tail is down, i.e., isTailDown() returns true.

raiseTail

public void raiseTail()
Lifts the turtle's tail from the ground so it won't draw a line when it moves.

Precondition: none

Postcondition: The tail is up, i.e., isTailDown() returns false.

isTailDown

public boolean isTailDown()
Returns true if the turtle's tail is lowered to the ground, false if it isn't.

Precondition: none

Returns:
true iff the tail is lowered
